intro: Aspidium plantianum, commonly known as the African mountain fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth or on rocky slopes. Its rhizomes are thick and fleshy, allowing it to store water and nutrients efficiently. Aspidium plantianum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various small organisms.
